alert.note: Alert for Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 10 at 1:20AM CST until December 10 at 1:45AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CST FOR TALLADEGA COUNTY... At 120 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Logan Martin Lake to Alpine to near Oak Grove, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Talladega, Sylacauga, Pell City, Childersburg, Talladega Springs, Lincoln, Vincent, Harpersville, Munford, Oak Grove, Waldo, Bon Air, Alpine Bay Resort, Winterboro, Talladega Superspeedway, Talladega Municipal Airport, Fayetteville, Grant Town, and Alpine. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for central and east central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
